content:
Yes, many other countries in the region have also implemented initiatives aimed at promoting sustainable fisheries. One of these countries is Indonesia, which has introduced various measures to combat illegal fishing and encourage sustainable fishing practices, such as vessel monitoring systems, the establishment of marine protected areas, and the ban on destructive fishing practices.

Similarly, the Philippines has also implemented several initiatives aimed at promoting sustainable fisheries, including the establishment of marine reserves and fishery management councils, and the promotion of sustainable fishing practices among small-scale fishers.

Malaysia has also implemented a number of measures to regulate its fishing industry, including fishing vessel registration, fishing license requirements, and the establishment of fisheries management plans.

Overall, many countries in the region have taken significant steps towards sustainable fisheries management, as they recognize the importance of protecting their marine resources and ensuring their long-term sustainability.
